page.title: 04 PLACES OF INTEREST
page.content: { Old Hall(now Park House):}Situated in Park Square it was probably the site of the Manor House belonging to Sir John de Wauton,Lord of Mashamshire in the 13th century.A family called the Fieldhouses have recently moved into the house. {Theakston's Brewery:}The brewery over looks Park House and is well known for its ale called 'Old Peculier'.Thomas and Robert Theakston began the brewing business 150 years ago at the Black Bull Yard. It is now a major employer in Masham. There is some doubt over its future at the moment due to a possible take-over bid by Scottish & Newcastle Breweries.The nearby Malt Roast is already closing. { The White Bear:}On the 16th of April 1941 two parachute mines demolished the pub and several cottages,killing six people.The pub was rebuilt (cont)
